section.title: Initialization
section.para: During start-up devball probes execution environment and provides helper variables that can be used in specs. Devball checks system architecture, platform and system release. All of those may be used to customize behaviour of specs, i.e. patching sources only on Mac OS X platform.

Additionally devball initializes may settings that customize internal behaviour, including installation prefix, location of specs, sources and patches, custom compilation and link flags. Those variables may be customized through devball configuration file.
Complete reference of all configuration related variables that are initialized during devball startup can be found in Variables section.
